tools¶

roipy.tools Module¶

I/O tools for interacting with ROI_PAC data arrays

roipy.tools.calc_fit(tsInstance, cumdef=None, pixel=None, fit='linear')¶

Make average

roipy.tools.calc_statistics(Set, signalmask=None)¶

Assign statistics to unaltered interferograms. NOTE: could do this for each stage in analysis in timeseries.py routine. signalmask is a saved .npy file where values of 1 makr known signal

roipy.tools.cart2los(self, dEW=None, dNS=None, dZ=None, look=None, heading=None)¶

Convert cartesian arrays into line-of-sight

roipy.tools.dem_phase_set(Set, hgtPath='/home/scott/data/insar/t6089/aux_files/radar_32rlks.hgt')¶
roipy.tools.export_latex_table(Set)¶

Export table of interferograms for use in latex files

roipy.tools.gdal2grd(path2GDALfile, outname=None)¶

Since EPD gdal doesn’t have netCDF support, must call external command

roipy.tools.georeference(Interferogram, amp=None, phs=None, trans='geomap_32rlks.trans', unwname='rect_result.unw', rsc='./aux_files/geo.rsc', dtype='f4', nanval=nan)¶

Use ROI_PAC rect_lookup.pl command georeference a .bil format file

keyword arguments: DESCRIBE new

Keyword Description
Interferogram Interferogram instance
amp (np.array) amplitude values
phs (np.array) phase or deformation values
transfile (str) path to .trans file for georeferencing

Outputs: geo_<>.unw, geo_<>.unw.rsc

Examples:

  1. view an interferogram in Google Earth:
>>> ig = rp.data.Interferogram(path)
>>> outpath = rp.tools.georeference(ig, './geomap.trans')
>>> ig_g = rp.data.Interferogram(outpath)
>>> rp.tools.save_kmz(ig_g)
roipy.tools.get_geotrans(GeoInterferogram)¶

(upper left x, w-e pixel res, rotation, top left y, rotation, n-s pixel resolution)

roipy.tools.grd2gdal(GRDfile, outname=None)¶

Since EPD gdal doesn’t have netCDF support, must call external command

roipy.tools.load_ascii(path)¶

Read ascii format array into a numpy array

roipy.tools.load_bil(Interferogram, dtype='f4', nanval=0)¶

Load amplitude and phase array from BIL files (eg .unw) output by ROI_PAC

Inputs Interferogram = roi_py.data.Interferogram instance OR path to file TODO: dims = (width,length) tuple to override .rsc dimensions geo = True if .unw is georeferenced to maintain correct array orientation

Outputs (leftArray, rightArray) = 2D numpy arrays

Example look,head = incidence file amplitude,phase = .unw file slope,elevation = .hgt file

roipy.tools.load_binary(path=None, dtype='f4', shape=(694, 203), orient='desc')¶

Read .bin output from matlab routines into an array #NOTE: also works for reading r4 files... Matlab saves to Column-Major (F) binary format but Numpy saves to Row-Major (C) binary by default. This routine automatically converts the binary array to C-order in memory for efficient subsequent operations

Inputs prefix = matlab output prefix as a string. [‘Def’, ‘MskDef’, ‘RmpMskDef’] path = full path to a binary file

Outputs data = 2D numpy array

Examples

  1. Load a particular .bin output file
>>> dem = ig.load_binary('t282.dem') #eg from get_SRTM.pl
>>> RmpMskDef = ig.load_binary('RmpMskDef')
roipy.tools.load_binary_old(tsInstance, igInstance, path=None, prefix=None, dtype='<f4', orient=None)¶

Read .bin output from matlab routines into an array.

Matlab saves to Column-Major (F) binary format but Numpy saves to Row-Major (C) binary by default. This routine automatically converts the binary array to C-order in memory for efficient subsequent operations

Inputs prefix = matlab output prefix as a string. [‘Def’, ‘MskDef’, ‘RmpMskDef’] path = full path to a binary file

Outputs data = 2D numpy array

Examples

  1. Load a particular .bin output file
>>> dem = ig.load_binary('t282.dem') #eg from get_SRTM.pl
>>> RmpMskDef = ig.load_binary('RmpMskDef')
roipy.tools.load_gdal(inFile)¶

Read any raster data format supported by GDAL into a numpy array returns data,geo,dim where data=numpy array, geo=geotransform values, dim=array dimensions

Inputs inFile = (str) path to georeferenced file

Outputs (data,geotrans,proj) data = np.array containing data geotrans = tuple of geotransform info (upper left x, w-e pixel res, rotation, top left y, rotation, n-s pixel resolution) proj = EPSG integer identifier

Example

  1. Read in raster array from a GDAL accepted format
>>> data,geo,dim = load_gdal(<path-to-raster>)
roipy.tools.load_half(Interferogram, half=2, path=None, dtype='f4')¶

Read a single array from a .rmg format file into memory.

.rmg format files contain two side-by-side equal dimension arrays that are stored in Row-Major (C) format and therefore have interleaved data stored as alternating matrix rows.

Inputs path = path to any .rmg format file (.rmg, .unw, .hgt) half = (1,2) load either first (1) or second (2) array

Outputs data = 2D numpy array

Example

  1. Load the amplitude array in radar coods
>>> amp = load_half('rect_090822-073109.unw,1)

#2. Load the phase array from a georeferenced interferogram

>>> geophs = load_half('geo_stack_32rlks.unw,2,True)
roipy.tools.load_ma(dataFile, maskFile=None)¶

open phase and mask arrays in .npy format and return a numpy masked array

roipy.tools.load_mat(path, length, width)¶

Read .mat output from matlab routines into an array Inputs path = path to any .mat file to be opened

Outputs data = 2D numpy array

Examples:

  1. Load cumulative deformation array
>>> cumdef = load_mat('pix2cumdef.mat')
roipy.tools.load_rsc(path=None)¶

Read from unw.rsc file & store metadata as an attribute dictionary named rsc

roipy.tools.match_date(Set, date)¶

Return a list of SERIAL dates that pair with a given date

roipy.tools.match_igrams(Set, date)¶

Return an array of SERIAL PAIRS interferograms containing a certain date (integer)

roipy.tools.orient_array(Interferogram, array)¶

Called from load() routines to put arrays in North=up, West=left, upper left pixel = [0,0] orientation

roipy.tools.save_bil(IG, path, amp, phs, dtype='f4', nanvalue=0)¶

save a manipulated array back to god’ole .unw format

roipy.tools.save_gdal(Interferogram, nparray=None, outfile=None, geotrans=None, proj=4326, nanval=None, format='ENVI')¶

Write numpy array to any raster format supported by GDAL.

Inputs Interferogram = roi_py.data.Interferogram instance nparray = np.array associated with Interferogram outfile = str output name geotrans = tuple of (upper left x, w-e pixel res, rotation, top left y, rotation, n-s pixel resolution) proj = EPSG integer identifier format = str format string recognized by GDAL (eg. ENVI, GTiff, GMT) NOTE: GMT support not necessarily built into EPD python

Examples:

  1. Save .unw as a GeoTiff in WGS84 lat/lon
>>> ig = rp.data.Interferogram(<path-to-ig>)
>>> ref = (-67.8716,0.00083,0.0,-21.1199,0.0,-0.000833)
>>> rp.tools.save_gdal(ig,'example.tif',ref,4326,'Gtiff')
roipy.tools.save_image(Interferogram, outname=None, data=None, caxis=(-1, 1), format='png', worldfile=False)¶

Save a 2D numpy array as a png with optional associated world file png has transparent background by default

roipy.tools.save_kmz(Interferogram, data=None, caxis=(-1, 1))¶

Write geocoded array as a png and save google earth kmz image overlay

roipy.tools.save_ma(dataFile, maskFile, mask_array)¶

save a masked array as a data array and logical array in .npy format. Prepend an optional prefix if desired

roipy.tools.save_r4(name, array, rscfile, nanvalue=nan)¶

save numpy array to .r4 format

roipy.tools.save_rsc(RscDict, filename)¶

write Interferogram.Rsc dictionary to a file
